chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal L. Kopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Crystal L. Kopp is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Crystal L. Kopp was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Crystal L. Kopp was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:45 P.M. Defendant Crystal L. Kopp in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf328, 15tr2054, 15tr2055 and 15tr2057. In 15cf328, State moves to amend Count 5 to possession of THC - 1st offense - a misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3 and 4 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 15tr2057 and 15tr2054 - Granted. Plea quesionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. 
Court Sentence
15tr2055
Fine - $762.00
Driver's License revocation - 6 months
AODA assessment
Driver's Safety plan

15cf328
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
AODA assessment and follow-through
Jail - 5 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday May 13, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
DNA
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given.
Adj. 4:05 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:22 p.m. Defendant Crystal L. Kopp in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf328, 15tr2057, 15tr2054, 15tr2055. Bail continued. Adj. 3:24 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

2:08 p.m. Defendant Crystal L. Kopp in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr2057, 15tr2054, 15tr2055 and 15cf328. Bennett statement, defendant unhappy with counsel - Bennett moves to withdraw and for new counsel to be appointed.  Court statement to defendant regarding appointment of attorney. Defendant states she believes Attorney Bennett thinks she is guilty and that is not the way it is supposed to be.  Court questions Bennett regarding attorney/client relationship. Bennett believes it is beyond repair. Court explains that attorney's belief of guilt or innocence of defendant is irrelevant - must provide sound advice. Court will appoint a 2nd attorney but will not be appointing a third attorney. Defendant is expected to make payments for Bennett's bill. Defendant instructed to contact Branch 2 office regarding new attorney appointment. Bail continued. Adj. 2:13 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:06 p.m. Defendant Crystal L. Kopp in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State will file Information that will mirror complaint. Bennett in receipt of Complaint, waive read - not guilty plea entered.  Court orders District Attorney to file Information no later than Monday, October 12, 2015. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm. Adj. 2:10 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

3:59 pm.. Defendant Crystal L. Kopp in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr2057, 15tr2054, 15tr2055 and 15cf328.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
